Evert, within the next couple weeks we will be posting a newly-accepted p=
aper including a new algorithm for substrate evolution, so we do have a the=
ory on that now (although it has not yet been shared publicly).  It should =
help to answer some of the questions in your post, or at least it should gi=
ve you a useful perspective.  

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "evertwh2=
004" <evert@...> wrote:
>
> I'm looking to co-evolve substrate templates fo=
r use with HyperNEAT. 
> 
> Probably most obvious is to evolve two CPPNs: a=
 structural one that generates the substrate layout and a connective counte=
rpart to fill in the weights. Maybe one can even develop a single CPPN that=
 does both. 
> But of course, one can use any generator technique for the s=
ubstrate template - it just seems so elegant to use the same technique for =
structure as well as connectivity.
> 
> Now, I remember some discussion on =
this topic in this list a while ago, but can't remember or find what came o=
f that.
> 
> Has anyone made any inroads into this research area yet? Any r=
eferences or pointers?
> 
> Cheers,
> 
> Evert
>
